properties.name: Wooden Cattle Bridge
properties.description:
Walkers Croft / Long Millgate bridge

Read more: http://www.manchester.gov.uk/info/511/conservation_areas/964/cathedral_conservation_area/2

You can see this map as the original access route for the single platform Victoria Station on the John Rylands University Library online catalogue:

http://enriqueta.man.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/maps2~1~1~340838~123201:Manchester-City-Centre?sort=Reference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CPage&qvq=q:map%2Bmanchester%2Bordnance%2Bsurvey;sort:Reference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CPage;lc:maps2~1~1,Manchester~91~1,ManchesterDev~95~2,Man4MedievalVC~4~4,nonconform~91~1,ManchesterDev~93~3,lib1~1~1&mi=3&trs=219

It is obscured by a higher level bridge on later maps:
http://enriqueta.man.ac.uk/luna/servlet/detail/maps2~1~1~339437~123115:Manchester?sort=Reference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CPage&qvq=q:map%2Bmanchester%2Bordnance%2Bsurvey;sort:Reference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CReference_Number%2CPage;lc:maps2~1~1,Manchester~91~1,ManchesterDev~95~2,Man4MedievalVC~4~4,nonconform~91~1,ManchesterDev~93~3,lib1~1~1&mi=202&trs=219

From here (http://www.urbexforums.co.uk/showthread.php/16027-Optimus-Prime-Manchester-Various-Re-visits-from-2011.):
"20ft below the Station can be found the original cattle bridge, which linked Long Millgate with Walkers Croft

It is now covered over and serves as a utility tunnel"


Also discussed in Underground Manchester (Warrender, 2007:73)
properties.title: Wooden Cattle Bridge
